Manager Response: Daniel,  Thank you for letting the world know the real truth about Best Western Orange Plaza. Wow you are amazing and a special kind of guy. You make our day at Best Western Orange Plaza.

Summary: Loved the 'suite' option the hotel had.  Hotel is currently undergoing some renovations in the lobby area.  Staff was very considerate.  Room was clean; seemed newly renovated.  Some minor room repairs could have been done prior to renting out, i.e., needs new bathroom fan, baseboard tile needs to be finished and / or caulked; iron should be cleaned out due to lots of calcium buildup; more stable ironing board and cover that stays on the board should be provided.  Snack and soda vending machines were not operational, maybe due to humidity; registered the money, but the mechanisms did not work.  The coin return did work so we weren't out anything, just inconvenienced bc we had to walk to the strip mall to get snacks around 930pm. Otherwise, it was a great stay and we would stay
Manager Response: What a great all around review. We appreciate your kind score and feedback. I apologize for the minor issues you ran across. As with every issue, we are looking to fix them all. You are the perfect guest and we hope to see you for future visits.  Thank you much from the Best Western Orange Plaza staff

Summary: The hotel room was newly decorated and very comfortable.  Our shower ceiling leaked and got the bathroom floor wet but everything else was very nice.  The hotel lobby was still under construction, but the service was good.  The staff was friendly.  The breakfast was OK.  All in all it was a good stay.
Manager Response: Judy thank you for staying with us, we are sorry about the ceiling leak during your stay. Here is an update, the cause of the leak was found, fixed and patched up. We hope that you will stay with us again on your next trip. Come and talk to me during your next stay, i'd like to know how things are with you.  Wishing you the best from Best Western Orange Plaza.

Summary Heading: Best Western, Best Peaceful, Clean Place
Summary: Best Service, rooms, breakfast, accommodations and easy access from highways. The staff are friendly and courteous. The are always polite and respectful. Our rooms are clean and well prepared for overnight visitors. And they expanded their breakfast area. Everything you could image and well staffed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback regarding the staff and cleanliness of the rooms. We hope you will consider Best Western Orange Plaza for your future travel needs. Thank you again for taking the time to provide feedback.

Summary: Close to lots of restaurants & a big mall, and easy to get Disneyland but cheaper because it's a little ways away. They reinvest in their business by remodeling. Older but not redown. Looked very nice. Also I felt secure there, no particular reason. And, for those who need it, a bus stop was right in front of the hotel. Could take it to Disneyland & shopping, etc.
Manager Response: The Best Western Orange Plaza team is very thankful of all the wonderful things you wrote about your stay. It feels good to know that our hard work and dedication can make a difference and that you noticed it. We wish you a great day and hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Booked through Expedia, got into our room to notice bugs all over the bed, and the refrigerator not working. We called maintenance to explain we NEEDED the fridge for daughters medication. The maintenance worker, very old man said "Go to store and buy a cooler" They REFUSED to change our rooms and then they LIED to our bank and said we stayed for one night! We left immediately when they REFUSED to help. WE DID NOT stay. This hotel is disgusting. They advertise false amenities and the hotel manager is incredibly RUDE.

Summary Heading: Going Through the Right Remodel in office
Summary: Value hotel close to Chapman University.  Currently going through a front office remodel to provide more room for free breakfast and business services.  Breakfast was being served in new space and was a much needed upgrade.
Manager Response: We like to think and have been told that we are the preferred hotel for Chapman parents. The staff at Best Western Orange Plaza wants to send a huge thank you for staying with us and leaving some positive feedback for future travelers to read. Lobby and business center are in the middle of a remodel scheduled through May 31st.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our trip. The rooms clean bed was awesome. The breakfast was delicious eggs, waffle bagels juice coffee bacon. We saved a lot of money eating our complementary breakfast every morning. It was one mile from historic Orange plaza. We will come again soon.
Manager Response: Such wonderful things to say about us and we thank you. We truly appreciate the time that you and other guests take to review our property on social outlets. Please visit us again and let us make you number one.

Summary: love this place because it is clean, comfortable, convenient to the ballpark where I go games and very cost effective.  A nice pool, hot breakfast --  what ekse do you need?  I have been using this facility for over five years and can think of no negatives.
Manager Response: Susan thank you for your valuable feedback. You are quite the VIP with Best Westen Orange Plaza. I'm sure future guests will appreciate your review when deciding to chose to stay with us.

Summary: We stayed one night only, room it's ok , for the price , they also offer free breakfast, which was very good ( surprise me ) they had plenty of fruit, eggs, juice etc,   Cons , we stayed on lower floor , a lot of noise from upper floor, was actually unpleasant.  Will stayed again due price,location .
Manager Response: Erik, Thank you so much for staying at Best Western Orange Plaza. We appreciate the compliments and understand your feedback. Please visit us again as we always strive to be number one in hospitality.

Summary: Had a very cool room right above the pool.  I liked that the lobby had breakfast and coffee.  Can t beat this place for the price and location.  I will 100% stay here again when I come to town.  All the people that worked there were very help full.
Manager Response: Wow thank you for the positive energy you have sent this way. It's great that you reviewed us and let the world know about Best Western Orange Plaza. I like our chances of 100% that we will see you again.  Have a powerful day.

Summary: This is an old-style motel in the charming city of Orange.  Despite the retro-appearance outside, the rooms have been very nicely modernized inside, with the amenities today's travelers expect.  Very close to Chapman U., and if you are traveling by car, convenient to the disney parks and Orange County beaches as well.  The city of Orange is one of the few Los Angeles suburbs that has retained old California charm without being kitschy or touristy.  Try the Chili Pepper restaurant around the corner, very good!
Manager Response: Thank you for your hip comments. Hopefully we can give you five star service the next time you stay with Best Western Orange Plaza.

Summary Heading: Economical, close hotel when visiting Chapman University
Summary: BW Orange Plaza is located right at a bus stop ($2 round trip, $1.50 seniors) that takes you directly to the train station adjacent to Chapman University. From this station you can go south or north throughout coastal southern California. You can also walk the 11 blocks to the campus and station. The hotel is quite standard for the price, with a reasonable breakfast included. Internet works fine. Plenty of stores and restaurants in easy walking distance. They make the effort to keep this hotel updated. Friendly, supportive staff. No problems in my room. Good work area plus table. Shower and toilet separate from rest of wash area, which is good when a couple is using the facilities.Restful bed. Closet had plenty of hangers, but they were the slightly annoying kind that must fit
Manager Response: Thank you for the detailed review. We can never have enough of them, they really help future travelers. We appreciate the praise you have bestowed upon us and welcome you back anytime. Please visit our renovated breakfast area now serving hot meals.

Summary: This hotel is a good price for a nice room near Disney. They are expanding the breakfast room to improve the breakfast service. Then for the price with a breakfast it is an excellent deal and only a short drive to Disney. It is located in a charming neighborhood.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review Best Western Orange Plaza. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please come back so that we can make your next experience a five out of five review for us.   Have a powerful day.

Summary: very happy will stay next year again was close to food and event we went to location was good easy to get to from road easy to exit with out problems rooms and service were great would recommend to anyone with out a problem thank you for great service felt like home
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Many thanks from the staff at Best Western Orange Plaza

Summary: We booked this hotel last minute.  We drove 8.5 hours to So Cal, attended an event nearby and drove home the next day.  We were beat when we made it back to the hotel.  The bed was weird, really soft almost like a water bed...but it wasn't.  I was afraid my back would be in bad shape the next morning but to my surprise, it felt better than it had it months.  The rest of the room did it's duty.  Enough room, storage, a desk and chairs to eat at (something too many hotels don't provide).  Our night was pretty quiet and best of all, the price was right.  Only real complaint was the staff when we checked out.  He was surly but not the end of the world.  Nice place to stay if you're in the area.  Not the fanciest but the price was great for what we got.
Manager Response: A good nights sleep ranks in our top three compliments for Best Western Orange Plaza. Stop by and make us your home away from home.  Nine more days until Christmas.

Summary Heading: Best Western Orange Plaza is a great place to stay. The staff is professional and the service is outstanding. The rooms
Summary: Best Western Orange Plaza is a great place to stay. The staff is professional and the service is outstanding. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. I enjoy the cable TV and access to WIFI. I always look forward to staying at Best Western Orange Plaza. It is centrally located to all of the amenities needed for a comfortable stay.
Manager Response: Dan,  The staff at Best Western Orange Plaza does the best that we can and that's all I can ask for as manager. We thank you for recognizing the hard work of staff members.  Happy Holidays

Summary: Hotel is a perfect getaway for Disneyland or any other nearby attractions. We stay here at least 5 times a year. Hotel is centrally located to the highways and was only a 15 min drive to Disneyland.  Plenty of dining options around hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for associating us with the happiest place on earth. Please book with me directly at Best Western Orange Plaza your next stay and earn discounts for feedback.

Summary: It is a very convient drive to Disneyland. Hassle free. Staff very accommodating. They offered good selection for breakfast.  Beds are extremely comfortable.  The handicapp room has an extra room for caretaker....which is very nice.
Manager Response: Another stay by another satisfied guest.   I love my job and it's guest like you that remind me of it, thank you for your kind comments.

Summary: This is really a budget motel in a sketchy area.  I was uncomfortable with the degenerates hanging around smoking and drinking all day.  There was a lot of noise and strange activity at night.  The room was okay, but you have to close the curtains, otherwise people would lear in.  The breakfast was convenience store food, although you could get an apple and a hard boiled egg.  The lobby/breakfast are is not so nice and could use a major cleaning.  The area is very strange, you can walk to one or two restaurants, a grocery store, ATT, but nothing else.  You can find a much better hotel for about the same price, or spend 20 bucks more and feel a lot safer.  The pool area is awful - right in the middle of the parking lot.  I come to Orange a lot, but will never stay here again.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that havefunCT did not enjoy their experience with us like many others have. I assure anyone reading this that we are a hotel and not a motel. Some facts I can point out, we are a Best Western and some of our amenities are an outdoor pool, free wifi and a business center. Best Western Orange Plaza is a non-smoking, pet free hotel however we can not tell someone that they can not smoke outside, nor can any other business in Orange, CA. We are located less than a mile from downtown Orange (the circle) and are diagonally opposite corner of grocery store. If you are looking for something to eat there are over five types of food places to eat across the street and the front desk has many nearby recommendations.  If you are reading this and you want to stay with an attentive and informative staff, please stay at Best Western Orange Plaza.

Summary Heading: Good moderately-priced hotel near major Orange County resort parks
Summary: Excellent, well-equipped room.  We were just in need of a comfortable, quiet place to sleep.  But, knowing the area quite well, this previously undiscovered hotel is conveniently located near major shopping areas in Santa Ana, historical downtown Orange, Disneyland, Anaheim Stadium, and Knott's Berry Farm.
Manager Response: From the team at Best Western Orange Plaza we thank you for hitting all the major key selling points for us. You made our day by letting us know we did our job.

Summary: We stay here once or twice per year when visiting family in Orange.  Convenient location, nice rooms.  Street noise can be loud when the windows are open, due to nearby fire station.  Breakfast is above average, staff is helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting everyone know this is a great place to stay douglas963. We are small location located in old towne Orange, if you get a chance look up old towne Orange and you'd bee amazed at all the history.  As a message to any future and potential guests, we would love to serve your hospitality needs.

Summary: I spent 7 nights at the Best Western Orange Plaza to visit with family and friends.  It is convenient to freeways 5, 22, 55 and 57 which makes getting around in socal easy.  Of course, downtown Orange is just so lovely just to walk around.  The king size bed was comfortable but the pillows are a bit lumpy and extremely large.  The continental breakfast is from 6am-10am and best to arrive early verses later for more choices.    The staff are super friendly and will assist with any needs!

Attended an event in Anaheim and needed a place for a quick overnight stay.  As you can see from the photos the room was very clean and tidy though I will say that the furniture and artwork is in serious need of a more modern upgrade.  Slight bit of traffic (white) noise but not a bother for me personally when you live in a sprawling metropolis like Los Angeles.  Their continental breakfast was the usual fare offered by Best Western.  I always appreciate having a protein option (eggs) and fresh fruit versus carbs.  There is also a Starbucks within walking distance across the street.  The only downside to my room was a bit of a strong smell of an ammonia-based cleaning solution.  Not enough for me to change rooms but could be bothersome for more sensitive people.  I'd recommend

Everything was good I.e. service, location, restaurants.  Room was very comfortable, shower was hot and strong, towels were good.  The bed was very comfortable   The continental breakfast was good I.e.fresh fruit, pastries, coffee,milk,juice,yogurt,breakfast sandwiches and waffles that had to be heated.  Since you are on a main street there is nite time traffic noise.  There is free WiFi a n  a small computer center.

We were on our 2016 college tour and visiting the nearby Chapman University and this was our hotel of choice.  We were lucky!  The location was great, very near Chapman.  The reception staff was excellent both for check in and check out and helpful and friendly.  I asked directions to several stores and restaurants and they went out of their way to help.    Breakfast was good for a "typical" continental with a few more options than normal.

We had a large group and the room we had was able to accommodate all of us without using a sleeper sofa!  The first room had 2 queen beds and a second small room had another bed.   The small room was a tight fit, but we were just there to sleep and then drive back home.  The room was clean and comfortable.

This is an average Best Western with a limited breakfast. But the location is ideal for a quick drive to and from a Anaheim Angels game. It's also very close to the historic town of Orange. There are plenty of choices for food in the area as well.

Wasn't too sure since this hotel seemed a bit "older" with a "motel" appearance from the outside, but that is where it ended.  The room was very modern and also very clean and well maintained.  Great sleep every night and one of the best showers I've ever had in a hotel of any type.  The staff were beyond friendly and accommodating and the free continental breakfast actually included proteins which most do not and real food opposed to packaged stuff.  Although a bit further from the Anaheim centre some decent amenities within walking distance including a grocery store, several restaurants etc.  Only negative was the wifi, although free did not work very well.  The only redeeming quality of that was that their wifi homepage offered quick access to local delivery and tourist

Great hotel! Timely service on check in and check out. The room was comfortable and there was cable TV. Orange Plaza is close to many amenities. The pool was great. I had a very nice experience staying at Best Western Orange Plaza in Orange California

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland
Summary: I spent two nights here in August 2016 for the sole purpose of visiting Disney, which is just a 10/15 minute drive away. The room was exactly as you'd expect from a Best Western; clean, comfortable, well-kept and with a good size TV. Reception staff were lovely and the complimentary breakfast had enough variety. There are a few eateries and supermarkets very close by which were handy. Overall an enjoyable stay!

Summary Heading: An Orange Trip Turned Sweet from Sour!
Summary: Arrived in Orange, CA and had forgotten all of my credit cards and identification at home.  A normally very organized former Hotel Industry Employee, I started to panic but the front desk agent was calm and extremely helpful in assisting me in doing what was necessary to get me settled in and comfortable.  Breakfast area was spotlessly immaculate each day and the area was not bad at all.  Drive down Chapman to the Orange Circle near Chapman University where you will find some really great dining options and plenty of interesting shops. NIce area, safe and clean, even late at night.  Would love to go back and explore more.

This is a Best Western with nice big clean rooms and a continental breakfast. My 2nd time staying here. It is convenient to the Chapman University campus where my daughter attends.   Make sure to call the motel when you book and identify yourself as a Chapman parent. They will give you a discount.   It is also convenient to Anaheim, Angels Stadium and a short drive to Disney. Close to the highway and there are nearby gas stations, stores and restaurants.

Summary Heading: Excellent Property to Stay At For a Great Value
Summary: This Best Western is our property of choice for hotel accommodations for the five years, and we would never stay anywhere else. My older daughter is a graduate of Chapman University, and my younger daughter is there now about to start her sophomore year. Roger Daugherty, the manager, has always been wonderful to us and very accommodating. It is a very clean and welcoming property, as well as a very convenient location to the university and Old Orange.

Summary Heading: Luggage ransacked, prostitutes, drugs, and maids that don't read English.
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Orange Plaza, in Orange, CA. for ten nights in July, 2016. I have to say it was the worst stay we've had in a hotel in many, many years. The things that made our stay bad were that the maids for several days went through our luggage and we had several hundred dollars worth of chocolates in the room near the end of our stay when the maids decided to shut off the air conditioning. For the first few days of staying at the hotel I noticed that the charging cords to my phone and other equipment were hanging out of my suitcase, which does not happen when I put them away myself. My wife mentioned that her personal items inside her luggage had been rearranged and her slippers were moved off her suitcase also. I thought that I had been carless

Summary Heading: Place to Park a 24 Foot Trailer
Summary: Nice place to stay. Older hotel but rooms had remodeled and were nice. I had moved my daughter to the area and needed a place to park my 24 foot trailer while we stayed a few more days. They were really nice to allow me to leave it in the parking lot while we were there.

Visited this hotel during a business trip. It offers a good value for your money and the location is pretty good (depends on your destination of course...). The room was pretty large, relatively clean, with a small handy kitchenette and the service was very cooperative. The room's facilities were not new\modern but had sort of 'heavier' atmosphere combined with a relatively low light. Breakfast was very basic in the small lobby. Bottom line is that I had a nice stay here.

Promise best possible price. after check in find out that internet price was over doupple cheapper. Ask for front desk, and they said that they know that, but cant do anything. I have been this hotel every year about 5-10 nights per year last 10 years. never again!

We had planned a trip to Disneyland, and chose this hotel (which is about a 15 minute drive away, $18 parking fee) after fruitlessly searching for a good price for one within walking distance of the park. We find Best Westerns are pretty solid places to stay, and this one was no different. The room was a pretty standard size, but it felt a tad cluttered due to a lot of furniture around the king-sized bed. And it's not an updated hotel, but still, it was very clean. The linens were crisp and the bed was very comfortable, although we found the pillows to be a little more firm than we would have liked. I wasn't a fan of the lotion and soap being provided in wall dispensers, but that's just a small quibble. A note in our room indicated if we had forgotten any other toiletries, they

Twenty minutes from the Nixon Library right in the heart of Disneyland, Angels stadium,  etc...and quite affordable.  The staff were all very friendly and quite helpful. David (of the Irish brogue) helped us with a quicker, shorter way to the Nixon Library. Plus he was of great fun.

We always stay at Best Western Hotels and this was one of the older models.  Outside of the low seat toilets this was an excellent hotel.  Everything was just great. When your knees are bad you need a higher seat. "staff was just great and helpful,

Nice small hotel in a good location.  Actually saw and heard fireworks from Disneyland.  Several good eating spots nearby. Great beds and slept very well considering there is a somewhat busy street nearby.

I had a wonderful stay at Best Western Orange Plaza. If you are reading this, I recommend staying here for your Southern California needs. The rooms are clean, the staff is knowledgeable and the prices beat the competition.

If you are looking for a budget hotel within Orange County, consider Best Western Orange Plaza. No frills, large and clean rooms, comes with free breakfast. We were travelling as a family and booked 2 rooms. Our relatives lived within Orange County so this was basically okay with us. We were also out touring everyday so this was really a place simply for sleeping and freshening up.   There are a couple of restaurants nearby (walking distance) too.    However, if you prefer better accommodations and expect a fancier hotel,  I suggest that you consider other hotels within the same area.

I stayed for six nights at this location. The desk people at Best Western Orange Plaza were some of the most efficient and customer friendly staff I have worked with in any hotel. They helped with changing reservations according to my changing itinerary, always with a smile and very efficiently. They helped me with other travel problems such as taxi cabs and local city busses. This is an old fashioned "motel" style layout but updated and very clean. The Wi-Fi was strong and reliable. I am very grateful to them for their wonderful customer service and smiling faces. Thank you!

Our hotel room was spotless. The staff were so helpful and caring. They helped us out with our car. It's rare to find people who will help a stranger. We stay here frequently since my daughter goes to Chapman University. It's not in the most picturesque location, but everything else about it is great.

Extremely clean and pleasant accommodations. Staff very pleasant and helpful.  Overall, a great experience.  I stay often due to proximity to my work but nearby shopping, restaurants, and other conveniences.

Summary Heading: Mike greeted me with a smile from moment I walked in door
Summary: Mike at the front desk greeted us with a smile as soon as my party walked through the door and had nothing but answers for us. We felt welcomed and comfortable during our entire stay and we will be back at this location next time we are in area.

Having 4 rooms booked we were accommodated with adjoining rooms and while we were only there for the evening and overnight everything was clean and well appointed.  The breakfast in the morning was simple, tasty and nourishing.

The breakfast has been upgraded. Rooms are simple yet elegant. The staff is knowledgeable and fun. I searched around the area and found that this hotel is value for your buck.  I will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

We finally found an affordable, clean and safe motel room in the Chapman area.  Staff was very accommodating for guests that arrived and left at various times. We were able to easily expand our number of rooms - and then when family members changed their minds, this motel gave us credit for the rooms that we did not need.

The room was very clean and well furnished.  Bed was a little too soft but perhaps perfect for others. Staff extremely professional and helpful. The only road noise we heard (2nd floor) was a few motorcycles on the street.  Good price. Breakfast okay. Location is close to shopping.

hotel looks okay... near to stores... I was there for business and visit some family... I really liked... the old town of orange is near by too. chapman university, it is perfect for any location...  Clean, well kept room. Close to freeways. Visiting family in Santa Ana....great choice for me. Close to restaurants. Will stay there again. Recommended!!!!

Summary Heading: Good place if you're going to the Angels game
Summary: I come up to Anaheim two or three times a year to see my home team play the Angels.  After staying at several places around the stadium area, I have settled into the Best Western Orange Plaza.  It is reasonably priced for Anaheim and close to a lot of attractions.  Breakfast is basic but adequate.  This is a no-frills kind of place which works for me.

Great experience The place is unassuming from the outside but great on the inside. Service and amenities were very good. There are lots of food places and easy grocery store  and banking access. I would say for sure give it your business!

Good location and not far from freeways and the Honda Centre.  No real restaurants in walking - but only a 5 min drive to a nice mall and 10 min drive to Restaurants and Honda Centre. Room was good as it had a separate room with TV.

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland, which is about a 15 minutes drive from the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, breakfast was fine and the location was close to several shops and restaurants, so all in all, we enjoyed our stay.

ok so the hotel is ok not nice but acceptable for a one night stay, with that said im not okay with some of the sketchy looking guest, the fact that deposits are 200.00 yet i get no microwave or sleep. i was sleep with my family until someone who looks like elmer fudd came beating on my door at 1:30 a.m. his words "i recieved a complaint of noise", impossible if we where sleep. my son is three he was sleep n so where we. instead of calling he decided to beat on my door and he didnt even seem remorseful after seeing how discombobulated we where. i became angry at his hostile, confrontational demeanor. i plan to file a complaint, after experiencing this i am unable to go back to sleep or have peace of mind. i was intentionally harassed and i plan on making sure proper disciplinary

Summary Heading: Adequate and Inexpensive near Chapman U
Summary: We find Best Western dependable. We made reservations at this hotel because of its convenient proximity to Chapman University. We were disappointed that there was no exercise room, but at least it had a reasonable pool. The bed was very comfy though the pillows were too big for our taste. Wonderful, plush bath towels! Breakfast: OK, continental style. We will probably stay here again.

Is an old motel - Don't plan on staying here if you want to sleep as the noise level is very high both outside the room and inside the room from neighbouring rooms (could actually hear the person above peeing in the toilet and the flushing/drains/floors were exceptionally loud).  Carpets were disgustingly dirty and the pool had a dog poop bag in it and a terribly film on covering the water so it's obviously not maintained

The overall stay was great, the staff I had contact with was great. the room was better than expected, we had the room with 3 beds which has the 3rd bed in it's own little room which my Daughter and her friend loved. The beds were comfortable and the TV was great. We did have a problem with the refrigerator in the room not working, one call to the front desk and the next day we had a new one. Looking forward to staying next year again.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on business or when travelling
Summary: Good location, clean, plenty of room and quiet. I didn't try the swimming pool, but the wifi was efficient and worked well, also the breakfast was OK. staff are helpful and a good decent motel all round. Stayed here while working, spenf 4 nights here, decent places to eat nearby and a few ATMs if you need cash, can walk into the "Old Towne".  PC at reception, with a printer, and free to use. Also a microwave coffee, tea and water available at reception. I thought it a pretty decent place to stay.

We had no major complaints, but the room and pool area and lobby area needed some additional personal touches as well as more choices for breakfast.  Seems some upgading is in order but the staff was all extremely helpful with warmth and professionalism.
Manager Response: Due to restriction limitations from the city of Orange regarding our breakfast we can not serve hot items such as omelets and waffles from a waffle maker. We are constantly upgrading our breakfast and we keep an open mind to any suggestions. Here is a list of our continental breakfast menu: hard boiled eggs, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, microwaveable waffles, whole milk, 2% milk, yogurt, cream cheese, apples, oranges, bananas, over 10 choices of pastries, bagels, english muffins, white bread, wheat bread, jelly, butter, orange juice, apple juice, regular coffee, decaf coffee, oatmeal, hot cocoa and an assortment of toppings for oatmeal and yogurt.

Summary: I don't want to be over critical of this hotel. It was a good price and would satisfy most people, as the reviews show. It was just a bit too basic for me - traditional motel room, slightly ageing bathroom although perfectly clean. The bed was reasonably comfortable and location was fine for the airport and resorts like Newport Beach. Breakfast was free, but as bad a breakfast as I have ever seen. Cold coffee, cheap ingredients - it went straight into the bin. Sorry but this hotel wasn't for me

The hotel was clean and it was close to the freeway, it was close to Disneyland where we wanted to go ,nice location close to a lot restaurants that we like and a lot of new ones too  to eat and just to see other things.

Beds were clean and comfortable, tiny pillows but lots of them.  Staff was VERY friendly!  Breakfast was typical, quick food for on the run.  Fresh fruit.  Packaged muffins, cereal, etc.  Bathroom was GROSS.  Wouldn't shower in it.  Moldy grout, needs a good cleaning or better yet, replacement!  Had a wheelchair accessible room with extra room with double bed.  Extra room was still locked when we arrived and had to call to get it opened.  It smelled stale.  TV was good, EXTREMELY happy with the "Fresh Remote".. one of my BIG pet peeves when staying in a room is a dirty remote control.  Pool was dirty.  Internet was available, but couldn't connect unless outside of room.  Overall it felt "sketchy", like a rent-by-the-hour hotel.  Needs a MAJOR facelift!

Excellent price for a very clean and comfortable stay.  Pillows were a bit hard.  The microwave in office was not easy to work. The staff was very pleasant. Rooms were clean, modern and quiet. Easy location to get around.

Summary Heading: A very good place to stay while on business
Summary: I hadn't stayed at this place for years, but needed a place in the area and saw a good rate at the BEST WESTERN Orange Plaza. It has definitely gotten nicer than it used to be. It is not an upscale property or very fancy, but for a business and frequent traveler it has all the basics - excellent staff, decent high speed wifi, comfortable rooms, and a convenient location in central Orange County. Depending on what is going on in the area, the price is pretty reasonable and the Best Western rewards program is pretty decent. I recommend it.

Very good stay. Enjoyed every bit of it. It was really great. Loved it. Thank you for very good service. Every aspect of the stay was really great. Will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. I lived staying there. .

We have stayed at this hotel 4 times in the past year and each and everytime it has been a pleasure! You can tell that the staff truly care about this hotel.The rooms are neat as a pin and the staff are extremely helpful.The few times we have asked for assistance the staff have helped immediately!Our compliments to the staff and owners of the establishment!We would recommend the hotel without hestitation!

Good Hotel.  a little noisy from outside noises and thin walls. beds were comfortable, but pillows were to hard. Website said there were hot items, which included prepackaged waffles and jimmy dean breakfast sandwiches. Overall good experience. great value.

Motel itself is quiet, though adjacent roads are very noisy, with emergency vehicles passing thorugh frequently. Premises are clean and reasonably well-maintained. Staff is friendly and helpful, although we did have to report a basic maintenance problem (no hot water) two days in a row until it was fixed.  As title of this review suggests, good value for the rate charged. Cab ride to Disneyland from hotel is about $20. Room was spacious

The property is well kept. Very clean and inviting. The gentlemen at the front desk was friendly. We live only 45 minutes away but wanted to Uber it to a party that was just down the street, so we were happy that it turned out to be pretty nice. The room was spacious and very clean. The vanity was outside the shower area so that was convenient. They also have a nice full length mirror. My only complaints are that the pillows were too hard. They were big so they looked like they would be on the softer side but nope. Way too hard. I woke up with a stiff neck which turned into a headache. My boyfriend, ended up not using a pillow at all so we didn't get much sleep because of it. We were planning on making this our place to stay when we came to OC, but I doubt it now. Also, the

My parents were invited to a wedding in the town of Orange and as Best Western members opted to stay at the Best Western Orange Plaza. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. On the negative side the beds were not comfortable - pillows were like logs but the bigger issue was the noise. Chapman is a VERY busy street and the hotel has no buffer to the traffic - cars, delivery trucks, and many, many emergency vehicles. It was unbelievably loud all 3 days we were there....

A hotel with just the basic room with bed and tv, they use soap dispensers instead of the little bars but they don't have one in the shower. The breakfast is not much more then juice, coffee, toast,etc. The hotel is close to CHOC.

The one night stay was quiet and peaceful. The hotel was surrounded by places such as Star Bucks; a large corporate grocery chain and a variety of places to eat in nearby communities.   The continental breakfast menu had a variety of foods to choose from.   Check out went smoothly.

Small place, close to Disneyland. Cute small town very active downtown. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull. Room was clean, 2 queen beds, in 1 room and a dbll size bed in another room. Room fridge, and micro wave. Carpets were worn and could use a fresh up. Not a very good selection of food for breakfast. It was quiet, and  fairly close to Disneyland, we drove about 10 min. Lots of places to shop nearby, Walgreen's right next door. There was 2 small tables in the lobby to eat at but were taken up by the business men with  laptops so we took our food and ate in the rooms. No elevators so you have to drag your suitcase up the stairs.The small room had no ventilation but a good size tv in it.

Short distance to restaurants, StJoseph Hospital and the freeway. Everything met my expectations. Room was pretty quite despite the hotel being next to a busy street. Lobby was clean and breakfast selection was good.

Stayed 10/04-10/07/15 in Room 217.  The hotel was a smaller complex.  Didn't look exciting from the outside but the rooms were comfortable and clean. The surrounding area seemed safe.  Parking is small but adequate. We did find a space each night when we came back late.  (Parking is free here, most places around Disney will charge)  There were several large stains on the carpet but the rest of the carpet was clean. (Socks didn't get black).  We wanted this particular room as it is 2 QN beds then a tiny room has a DBL bed in it.  The bathroom has a shower/tub and toilet.  Then outside is the sink with a longer vanity.  This is nice so there is room for somebody to get ready while somebody else is showering.  I just wish there was stronger lighting above the vanity.  Most Best

Summary Heading: It's Such a Pleasure to Stay at This Best Western
Summary: Our family never stays at any other hotel, because we really enjoy the comfort of the rooms, the ease of parking, the breakfast that is included, and the gracious, professional, and very helpful staff. They always make sure our needs are fully met, and we only stay at Best Westerns on our vacations. It is also wonderful to be a rewards member, where we can earn points for free night stays and special offers. We really appreciate all of the perks we get when we are at a Best Western, and we feel very much at home in your hotels. We highly recommend it to other patrons.

Recently we stayed at the Best Western in Orange,CA to spend time with our daughter who is a Disney cast member and enjoy some time at Disneyland and California Adventures. We enjoyed our time at this hotel where we used a suite.The property was extremely clean and comfortable.It is close enough to get to Disneyland quickly and yet far enough aware from the hustle and bustle of the park. We highly recommend it!

The hotel is with in 10 minutes of Disney and easy freeway access ... yet a better deal than Anaheim. The City of Orange  does not have the mandatory  per night parking fee which Anaheim imposes on their over night guest.  We will be back.   The breakfast is simple. The room is clean neat.

Very surprised at the neatness, quality and professional staff at this older location.However you would never know it with very clean rooms, 50 inch flat screens and full cable. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Much better when you get into the room!
Summary: When I first pulled up to this motel, I thought that I would be changing hotels, but once I went into the room, it was actually quite nice.  This location is definitely a motel make-over, but it's not bad.  It is convenient to the Orange circle which has a number of cute restaurants, and is about a mile away.    It also has a Ralph's (full service grocery store) across the street, and a Walgreen's pharmacy next door.  The breakfast is included, but mediocre.  For the price, it's a decent value.

Attended a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center. The prices that the hotels wanted were obscene. Found this hotel and read some reviews. About 7 minute car ride to the show. Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Bed was very comforable.Internet worked well and the breakfast was acceptable. A Great value. This hotel would make a great base for a Disneyland trip.

The sleeping was great. The breakfast was not. Clean, quiet, comfortable room. Food was bread products primarily. Parking was adequate. Staff was helpful and friendly. Price was good. I love Best Westerns.

The Best Western in Orange was just perfect for a 6 night stay!  The location was great for Mom and I to visit with friends and family.  The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable and the overall room was neat, clean and newly upgraded.  We would definitely stay here again!

Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast options were good and there were a number of nearby restaurants to choose from within walking distance. Despite a busy street next to the motel, the room was quite enough.

What a wonderful place to stay for a quick in and out to get on down the road on time in time. I love the coolness and the feel of the linens here at Best Western Orange Plaza, Orange California. What a super duper place to stay!

Nice big room; comfortable bed.  Jacuzzi tub was a nice surprise after a stressful day. Staff was very helpful.  It was a little difficult to get into parking lot from one direction due to traffic divider, but all in all a great place.

First two days had fruit flies flying around sink & other bugs, insects crawling around.  Shower dispenser fell off first day and maintenance didn't return to complete repair.  No eggs or meat items offered for breakfast.  I only chose this hotel because it was centrally located for our business trip of finding housing for our daughter in Irvine.  I do not plan to stay here again.  Will choose a Best Western Plus/Premier next time.

Summary Heading: in a pinch and need a nice place
Summary: If you need a room for a night or two of quite comfortable sleep, close to but not next to all the attraction. Then you'll enjoy staying here.  Closer to the center of Orange but just a hope to Angel Stadium, Disneyland and the Beaches. Ralph and Walgreens  next door and a Dennys up the street.  If you want to save money and don't need all the frills then this is a perfect place.

The Night shift clerk was very rude and yelling on us, Pointing his finger at our face just because I did ask the other customer to move her car a little bit forward so I can pull my car off the street, she did park her car just in the middle of the front lobby when it was raining very bad.

Location was excellent, easy access to every venue in Orange county. Very nice staff and accommodations. We will be back. Close to stores and pharmacy, walking distance. Restaurants everywhere. Easy access to freeways. Only concern was parking .

We used this hotel for our Disneyland trip. The room was a decent size and clean. We didn't get to use the pool on site but several people were using it during the stay. The hotel staff was helpful in directing us to an off-site laundry facility. The breakfast was mostly packaged, nothing hot or fresh. This worked for us because we were out the door early and were only able to grab some bananas, apples, milk and pastries as we walked out the door. It was a quick and easy 10 minute drive to Disney. We have recommended this hotel to family that is traveling to Disneyland soon.

This was a comfortable hotel.  We stayed in a room with a king size bed, with an attached room with a double bed.  It was very clean.  The bathroom was spacious.  My only dissatisfaction is that the attached room did not have its own air conditioner so it was a little stuffy at first.  We were able to open the window. Overall, it was a hotel that I would use again.

I stayed a couple nights with my family, the place was very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this place to stay.  If I need to stay in the area again, I will stay at this location. The pool was very refreshing and housekeeping did a very good job.

This hotel is down the street from CHOC children's hospital. We stay here when my 4 year old has appointments. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and the beds are decent. We like the Best Western brand of hotel for the price and the continental breakfast they offer.

We stayed 9 nights. Staff was friendly, and cooperative.Everything was clean. Pool was clean and very comfortable temperature.Enjoyed our stay! Stayed in a first floor room. Parking lot would get close to full sometimes - but there was always a spot. Next time we are in Orange, we will consider staying here again!

This was an exceptional hotel, extremely clean, outside well groomed, staff always available.  Will definitely stay here again if in the area.  Stores and restaurants within walking distance, if needed.  Quality was well beyond what I was expecting.  This property is obviously well cared for.

Summary Heading: Not Bad if You Like Garage Sounds
Summary: Stayed here for a weekend visiting family.  The room was reasonably clean and the breakfast was normal continental fare.  The least appealing part of our stay was the local mechanic garage that had very loud equipment that would torque up every morning - not ideal.  Staff was accommodating when we needed to extend our stay.

These guys are great. All the staff is awesome. Some are more awesome than others....but it all comes down from the top dog. Roger D. lets the staff be as good as they are by BEING a good person. My view of how the experience of the team working together is that they all BEING viral-ly good people as the willingness to be a good person IS allowed to happen!

Summary Heading: Tried the BW Orange Plaza Hotel instead of BW Meridian Plus
Summary: I actually liked the Orange Plaza better for 3 reasons: 1. Smaller and seemed cleaner and in better condition than BW Meridian 2. Internet access far superior than BW Meridian which was useless 2 weekends ago 3. But, the staff was friendlier and more willing to converse and make you feel at home (although they had know idea how to improve the internet access) at the Meridian.  The lobby manager at Orange Plaza was dry, no eye contact, not very friendly really.

Very nice room in a great location, just a mile west of central Orange traffic circle. Quaint! Several good restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores nearby. Quiet! 2-story with no elevator! A minus! Nice, friendly staff! Very helpful! Con'l B'fast included. Very close to Disneyland plus Anaheim Angels (MLB) and Ducks (NHL).

This hotel is not a Plus or a Premiere, but it had a very nice room that was clean and modern.   The room was thoughtfully organized.  The breakfast was limited, but pretty good considering there wasn't much space.

I truly enjoyed my last stay at this Best Western (Orange, CA).  It had the most comfortable bed and cleanest smelling sheet I can remember.  The room was very clean and well decorated, we did not watch much television however the 40 inch flat screen was appreciated when we need tot watch the news.  Great Job B.W !

This hotel was exceptionally fresh and clean - in and out! The bed was very comfortable. Everything in the room was very clean and worked as it should have. All service people were very friendly and competent. It was a great experience. I would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Recommendation of Best Western on West Chapman Avenue in Orange, CA
Summary: This is a wonderful property and we always enjoy staying at your location. Roger Daugherty, the manager, is always great and makes our stay more pleasurable. He is very professional and always meets all of our needs. We also love the accommodations and the added benefit of the continental breakfast for the value.

Great location but motel needs an upgrade and new carpets.  Free breakfast is exactly what you paid for.  Staff was sympathetic but not very helpful when we did not have hot water one night.  Insufficient number of parking stalls.

The hotel staff was very nice and the location is good.  The breakfast is not very good.  The room smelled a bit musty  It is a very old building and was rough around the edges.  I will pick another hotel next time I am in the area.

The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff are friendly. The breakfast is reasonably good. I just wish that they had a larger area for serving breakfast. But overall, I had a nice experience in this place  and I certainly recommend it to the others.

I stay at this BW quite a lot and enjoy the accommodations and the way the staff treats its customers.  The location suits my business needs when I am in Orange County.  It is close to the old city of Orange with wonderful restaurants.  Easily accessible from all freeways.

I have stayed here on a couple of occasions. The room is clean, the staff is polite, the breakfast is acceptable. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a night or two. No lobby or common area other than the pool adjacent to the parking lot on a buy street.

The front desk manager and reception workers did not treat me like a customer, they treated me like a nuisance. I am a young, 30-something high school teacher, who brought four students to compete in a festival at Chapman University. Upon check-in, I was told I couldn't use our school's credit card to pay for the room, which I understood since it didn't have my name on it. But rather than suggest a solution, I was treated like a criminal who had stolen a credit card and was "trying to get me fired". That was the direct quote I heard from Ron at the front desk. I assured him that I was not trying to get him fired, but that we needed to figure out a way to have the school assure them that I could use the card and was authorized to do so. After giving me quite a bit of attitude, he

I am giving this location of Best Western 4 starts because it is a great place for Orange.  The rooms are clean and quite comfortable.  The have a few larger rooms for families, so if you need that be sure to ask for the rooms with the extra double.    I have stayed here multiple times and it is my preferred location for visiting Orange itself.  It is a motel - right on Chapman Ave. You park right out front and walk to your room's door.  The location is totally walkable to the circle in downtown Orange and to Chapman.  Also, close to CHOC.  If your visit is focused on activities in the opposite direction, I would look at other hotels in Garden Grove or Anaheim, as there are much nicer hotels there at comparable prices - compared to that location, this Best Western is a 3 star

Summary Heading: Great Room and Price, Excellent Staff
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel at least a few nights each year over the past several years. Great price. Excellent staff. Good quality bed and pillows. During my last trip, I chilled a bottle of bubbly in the mini-fridge so we could toast our successful conference presentation at one of the big convention hotels down the road. I will definitely stay here again, anytime I travel to Orange County. Great restaurants less than a mile in lovely Orange, the city. I walked some of the time.

the owner or head of the hotel started to raise the price on us only because we were staying there too many night so they say, I say the more you stay you should be rewarded. they wouldn't let us get a room unless we paid $150 for a standard room that doesn't even have a microwave. a standard room rates between $70-85.  I felt discriminated

The room was open and bright. Large tub and shower. Great pool and spa area. Wonderful appetizers in the bar. Bar tender was terrific!Good place to stay if you have a family because the pool area is huge!I would not call this a romantic hotel but it's more geared to families and business guests. Close to the airport and city.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Best Western Orange Plaza, CA
Summary: Great Hotel - Best Western Orange Plaza,  CA. Service was great, Room was great, Pool was great, Checkin was great, parking was great, cable TV was great, Phone was great. Ice Machine was great. Cleanliness of room was great, Location was great. Room Temperature was great. Refrigerator was great. It was a great experience to be staying at the Orange Plaza Best Western Hotel in Orange California.

We stated here while dropping our child off at Chapman University.  The room was clean and comfortable and great for the price.  if you stay here i highly recommend the mexican restaurant around te corner called "The Chile Pepper.'

I have stayed in three other motels in the Orange, Calif. area in the last two months.  This motel beat all of the others hands down.  Location was great and overall stay was great for the price.  I would recommend this motel to anyone looking for quality and good value.

Secured place to stay. Good place to stay. would recommend for others for sure. Secured place to stay. Good place to stay. would recommend for others for sure. Secured place to stay. Good place to stay. would recommend for others for sure.

We had a clean and comfortable room.  Freindly staff that made you feel welcome.  The maid service was excellent.  We had a very enjoyable experience. The locatioin was very near where we wanted to be.  Easy to get in and out of and close to shopping and freeways.

Did not know this was a barely remodeled motel, or we would never had stayed there. We are used to having nicer accomodations. Now we know why AAA gave it such a terrible rating. There was mold growing on the floor and baseboards in the bathroom. There were some sort of bugs on the bathroom floor. The room smelled like bleach. I think they were trying to cover something up. The security bar was completely broken. We had to put a chair up against the door to prevent "unwanted visitors" in the middle of the night.

I was amazed at how nice the rooms were, since the building look's old. They are nice and updated, friendly staff and comfortable beds. I will stay here again next time I am in the area. The have nice rates as well

Summary Heading: Great value within walking distance of almost anything you need!
Summary: This li'l hotel is so close to freeways (5, 57 & 22) and 2 major hospitals and OC Govt facilities and yet just far enough away that they don't impact you at all. The best thing tho is that SO many stores, markets and restaurants are within walking distance: it's great!  It's a great value right in the center of OC.  My room was very nice and I stayed an extra day. I'd stay there again for sure and recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you Karen for giving us an honest guest point of view of Best Western Orange Plaza. To show our appreciation for taking the time to write a review we would like to honor you 15% off rack rate of your next stay. Print this message or mention the post on Trip Advisor when making your next reservation.  Happy Holidays!

Summary: Always very happy to stay here. Staff is first rate, rooms immaculate (not fancy, but always comfortable and well cared-for). Totally reliable. A restful oasis during busy and demanding travel. Worthy of high recommendation!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting the world know about your experience here at Best Western Orange Plaza. We appreciate your repeat business. Your feedback helps us improve, we want to let you know we care and can not thank you enough for your honesty.

Summary: I needed to say close to Chapman University for finals. I was worried that the location on Chapman Ave would be loud and I wouldn't be able to sleep but I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was. Room was clean, and had an upscale bed and shower for a two star hotel. Breakfast was your typical Costco pastries/fruit/yogurt but adequate. The hotel provided everything I needed to focus on finals.

We booked ourselves into the Best Western, Orange,Ca thinking it was a hotel. It turned out to ne a motel with typical motel breakfast *coffee, juice, pastries, cereal; period) The staff was very pleasant and helpful but this wasn't what we expected I guess we  should have asked questions when we booked

I visited my granddaughter, a Freshman, at Chapman University and stayed at Best Western Orange Plaza.  It was convenient to the campus, on a main street, near restaurants and other needs.  It was fairly simple going to and from campus and near the many freeways that are necessary in the area.

I would definitely stay at Best Western Orange Plaza again.  Even though it is a smaller hotel, the staff is first class and the accommodations are great.  You can tell the people take pride in their work.

Summary Heading: Oh Man. Bed Bug Attack here
Summary: We were here the end of July, ground floor near the office. Over two nights we had bed bug bites. At first you don't know what the bite looks like.  We waited. After the second night with the same thing we went to Urgent care on our check out day. My wife had bites and were now starting to show infection.  So one shot, ten days of a pill a day, an ordeal. The Urgent care faxed the BW at the report, they did return our payment for staying two nights.  We have stayed here many times, NEVER EVER again. There are other choices in Orange, look around.
Manager Response: We have received great reviews from this guest in the past, but there was an incident with bites during his last stay. We have apologized to the guest, issued a full refund and offered a sizable discount when he returns. I am letting anyone know who reads this that bed bugs are unacceptable here.  We take many preventative measures here such as employing an outside pest control company Ecotech to spray every room and the exterior of the building every month, during busy months Ecotech comes out twice, all beds have a bed bug mattress protector, maids and management are trained online in preventing bed bugs and spotting bed bugs, we have a UV light specified for tracking bed bugs on property, and we continue to read up on any new developments on fighting all pests. Unfortunately this is a never ending battle that all hotels have, bed bugs are really good travelers and can be transferred to any hotel by a guest who is unaware they have these hitchhikers.  Please feel free to contact Ecotech Pest Control Solutions 1-888-PEST-180 and verify that they service our hotel. There is also a website and yelp page for Ecotech if you wish to see how dedicated they are at eliminating pests.  Michael Nuño Front Desk Manager 714-633-7720

Summary Heading: for the area, a good solution
Summary: In Orange County there is a wide spectrum of hotel facilities, from the inferior to the very luxurious. If on a regular business trip in the area this hotel is a very honorable compromise, in an area that is easy to reach, or go around from. Personnel is very kind. And finally a TV with ample choice of decent channels.

Summary Heading: Fabulous experience at this Best Western Hotel
Summary: I was most pleased with my service and experience at this Best Western Hotel.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone and I would stay there again if I were to return to the area.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  They went the 'extra mile" to be sure I had a downstairs room.  The location was ideal in being near a freeway and had many restaurants and shopping available nearby.

Stayed four nights on business wanted the value this property offers compared to other chains in the area and was not disappointed.  It is true that the property is 'old school' but it was still acceptably clean and safe and a good location.  Never tried the breakfast.  I noticed they changed the window dressings during my stay including curtains and valence.  Keys didn't work one night due to some system change the hotel made but should have notified patrons about ahead of time, instead of all patrons finding their keys not working and having to walk to the reception to tell them the keys didn't work and get replacements late at night.

Summary Heading: Great value for your hard earned dollar
Summary: The B W of Orahge on Chapman Ave is my go to favorite motel in the area.  I travel to Orange frequently to see my son in college there.  I feel completely safe 24 hours a day there.  The location cannot be beat for its close proximity to Chapman University.  Nice pool , that no one ever uses.  Great TV sets . Great internet connections. While it is a motel it feels like a hotel because elf how personable the staff is.

Overall the stay was great.  Check in was very easy, location of the room was also easy to locate.  The room was very nice, clean, plenty of supplies.  The are was very quite, you could not hear the traffic at all.  Directions given to me to get to the conference from the hotel was very much welcomed. Staff very courteous.  The continental was ok...

Location is excellent. Property needs serious updating and better maintenance. The owner is obviously milking this hotel, as evidenced by the lack of investment in it! Rooms are straight out of the '70s. Early '70s.

We stayed her because it was convenient to Chapman University where our granddaughter attends and for homecoming.  That and friendliness of the staff make this "Very Good".  The room was of adequate size, at a fair price and staff was friendly and generally helpful.   When we checked in on Saturday afternoon I reported an energy saving light switch not working properly at 3:00 PM and was told that maintenance staff had gone home for the day - this on a Saturday when all rooms were going to be full that night with likely associated room problems!!  The light switch was apparently not looked at as it remained flaky for the rest of the stay but we found a way around it.  The air conditioner fan was a bit noisy but I'm afraid that it is a function of the design of the unit.

We stayed at the hotel to visit our daughter who is an intern in the Disney College Program.We would highly recommend your hotel! The hotel is about three miles from Disneyland.It is quiet and in close walking distance to shopping, obtaining gasoline and food.The staff were great!

We stayed here on recommendation from friends and reviews from Trip Advisor.  Friendly check in, room 215 big enough room, table & chairs, kind of old style room, very clean and separate vanity to toilet / shower area. Great pillows and four of them, good towels, soap, shampoo etc was on the wall in dispensers - cool idea. They even had half soft toilet paper (which was a surprise).  World's most powerful shower (in a county suffering bad drought, go figure!), felt guilty taking a shower. Used the pool area, nice could do with a bit more shade though. Missed the breakfast but on checkout grabbed some apples and muesli bars. Had dinner at the Black Bear Diner next door, good too. Would stay again.

We have been coming to this place for the last five years since our oldest son and his family live less than a mile away. It is clean, comfortable and inexpensive; now, that our son has a baby, our visits will be more frequent so it's great to have a reliable and available place to stay.

Doesn't look like much from the street. However, my room was refurbished (dual pane windows, marble in the bath, etc.). The room was clean and comfortable and given the price I paid, this was a great deal. Breakfast is just rolls, muffins, coffee and juice. Still, everything tasted good. I have stayed here in the past and I will probably stay here in the future.

Summary Heading: Something I would have not expected
Summary: When we arrived we were greeted in an extremely friendly manner which was from the heart and not just an "American show"! The rooms are very tidy and of a very reasonable size. The layout was somewhat different as the toilet and shower are separated from the sink which is within the bedroom. This seemed strange but has definitely its advantages.   It is also worth mentioning the very good coffee you can have which is well above the normal standard.  Asking the staff for a particular restaurant we were recommended exactly what we were looking for and the directions given were ultra precise.   This hotel I would most definitely visit again once within the area.

Very friendly desk. Michael is his name. Got there early, room was ready. Very clean and modern looking. Just keep in mind, no microwave in room. Area around motel was good. Gas, groceries, shopping in 1/4 mile radius. Bus stop right next to motel. Good stay and would recommend to anyone going to southern California.

Summary Heading: GREAT MOTEL; staff needs personality transplant
Summary: Was here on Business, The Room:perfect. The Grounds and area VERY QUIET.almost silent. The decor was modern and the housekkeeping staff very genial. However there was one in particular FRONT DESK EMPLOYEE that was a real MORON, wouldn't make eye contact, no sense of humor. Why have someone "like that" in the "hospitality industry"??   There was NO FUN in what this person was doing,. real in-ept. THE OTHER EMPLOYEE was all "stuffy" Like what hye was doing was SOOOOOO important. He acted like he was "going out of his way" What an Idiot. There are NICER hotels W/o the crummy continental breakfast for less than $119

I stayed at this motel for five nights. Now I have hundreds of bites from bed bugs. The manager I spoke with twice said they didn't find an infestation which is what I assumed he would say. How could he admit finding them. I want a refund, but the manager just made light of the situation and made snarky comments. For instance, saying he would ask the next bed bug he sees where they hide when I said he must not know what he's looking for if none were found. I have hundreds of bites. Some are on my face and eyelid which is swollen. I have photos of my face and worst areas of bites. Many are developing blisters. I've only been at my home since my stay there and I'm of course worried that some eggs may have been on my property and are now in my home. I made a report to the Bed Bug

This is a very nice hotel.  Comfortable bed and very clean premises and rooms.  We were very impressed.  There is a limited continental breakfast, but we were satisfied.  Wi-fi available, which we used.  We would stay here again if in the area,

Stayed overnight on a business trip. I didn't want to spend a fortune and this Best Western provided a good basic room at a fair price. This is a 2-story building with exterior access to the rooms. The room and bath were clean with no problems. There is free open parking available.The breakfast isn't much (coffee, juice, muffins) but there are plenty of places to eat in the area. Although there is traffic noise from Chapman, the room windows are dual pane so it wasn't a problem. Yes, I would stay here again.

This is a decent hotel, nothing special but nice for the price. A bit noisy from the neighboring rooms, showers were loud. Close to freeway access. Several stores and restaurants close by.  Not a bad price for S.California, Disneyland and the amusement parks fairly close by drive prices upwards.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids
Summary: When searching for a hotel, I always try to get free breakfast included.  Although this hotel offers the free breakfast, it was nothing more than toast, fruit, drinks and cereal (hot and cold).  Not too bad for quick, easy and free.  I was just looking forward to waffles :(  On the flip side, the hotel was everything we were looking for; close to Disneyland, quite, friendly and clean.  We got a two room deal, which was perfect for a family of 4.  Main room with king and bathroom setup. The second room was just a double with night stands, a dresser and most importantly, a tv.   The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean (even the remotes).  This stay has made me a Best Western fan!   I will stay here again when in the area, and plan somewhere else for a tasty

Great location if you are visiting Chapman.  Easy in/out style.  Nice staff.  Respond to issues right away.  Basic breakfast. Everything clean - parking lot well lit.  Very good price, and just a lot easier than the big hotels with parking, elevators, lobby business.

We stay at this facility whenever in Orange, about every 6 weeks.  The staff is very accommodating, the room is clean and the beds are super comfortable!   The refrigerator in each room is an added plus!

The staff at the hotel were very helpful.  We had an uncertain stay time, and left items in the room by accident when we left.  The staff accommodated our every need and were very cheerful.  I'd stay here again.

This Hotel is a very well kept Hotel, and I lived in the City of Orange for 23 years and just stumled across this GEM of a Hotel. To anyone who needs a GREAT ROOM at a GOOD RATE. Reserve your next stay here if you are in the area and need a room. ENJOY YOU STAY  The Napolitano Family

Hotel was nice to stay at, very friendly staff.. Pool was wonderful to swim in and perfect location for us in accordance w our room. Breakfast was the only things that was the best.  Not much to pick from and the breakfast eating area was very small and only held 7 people at a time.

Summary Heading: Best Value for the price - Chapman University
Summary: Team on site works hard to keep place clean, maintained and functional.  Great price for the location - near Chapman University and downtown Orange.  Starbucks & Ralphs across the street!  Free WiFi is good accept you have to sign on each time.

We have always stayed here when visiting our daughter at Chapman University.  She was an excellent student and we don't have a lot of money.  This was a great place to stay, affordable which says something in Orange County, and clean.  very friendly staff.

This hotel is so nice. The staff is great, and the rooms are clean. They have done a lot of improvements and the inside and outside are always clean. I consider the hotel my home away from home, and it also is centrally located.

This was an ok place to stay for the price. Only stayed 1 night.  They should block out a room and make it the breakfast room.  It's the lobby of the hotel and it's very, very small.  For what we were looking for it worked for us.

This is such a great place to come back over and over. The crew is the same, they are all pleasant. I discovered a Mexican Cafe across the street that had excellent breakfast. Even tho it is free here. Nice and clean and the bed is so good, i may buy one like it. Can t complain

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: I wish there was a 21/2 star option because the Best Western Orange Plaza isn't as much poor as it is what you would expect from a budget motel.  And it is a classic motel, which was not clear to me from the Web site when I booked.  On the up side the room was clean and the staff was friendly.  Our room was quiet, even with families milling around by the pool.    Location is convenient - downtown Orange and Chapman U are both 5 or so minutes away.  Enough restaurant choices around.    If I were to go to Orange a couple times a year I'd look for a different hotel.  But in a pinch this works.

We have stayed at the motel twice now and highly recommend it. It is a very well maintained motel in a very good location. Helpful staff and breakfast included. Also try the Chili Pepper Mexican restaurant just down the street.

Have stayed in the facility for years, as have other family members.  Staff is always friendly, room is always clean.  Conveniently located to all Orange has to offer as well as easy freeway access to other So. Cal locations. It is the best!

I try to stay at Orange Plaza when in OC, and consider it my home away from home. The staff, the condition of the property, and convenient location. A good value for the price as well.. Although it is older, they are always working on improvements. But, the most important thing is the friendly, helpful staff, that goes out of their way to make you feel like a  valued guest, not a customer.
Manager Response: Bev, yes we are your home away from home. We love having you, always so positive. Don't forget, I want to know how well your granddaughter is doing in basketball. Until then we'll keep #107 ready for you.

Summary: As I drove in I did not think it would be a very good hotel but the staff was very kind and when we got to the room it was great - clean and updated.  Well worth the money and worth staying a little away from the main area of Disneyland.  The extra bed was in an additional room which the kids thought was great.
Manager Response: We are glad that we were able to make a delightful impression on you and hope that you will be back next time you are in the area. We definitely do our best to stay updated and always look for ways to improve. Thank you.  We like to thank guests who write reviews with 15% off their next visit. Shane, please print this out and show to our front desk agent for discount off standard rate.

Summary: Water backup into the tub/sower.  Reported problem for 3 days until finally moved to another room.  This problem could create a major health issue.  The staff did not seem to care and there appears to be no maintenance person available to fix problems.
Manager Response: Steven, We are sorry that your situation was not handled in a timely manner. We want all of our guests to have peace of mind that they are in a clean and sanitary hotel, the whole staff apologizes. All of the problems you had with your stay have been taken care of and we want to have you back as a guest.  Please consider giving us a second chance. Print this page out and show it to our front desk agent for 20% discount off standard rate.

Summary: The staff were great, very helpful. The room was a King with a Double and the double had its own room. Our grand daughter (5) whom we visited, was very happy with having her own room. The rooms were very spacious and quiet. The location was a plus, as a pharmacy, grocery store and several places to eat were with in walking distance. The rates are great and we were surprisingly close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for spreading the news about our King Double rooms. The description you gave was excellent. For larger groups, we have a couple rooms with two queens in the main room with a double in the side room. There is also one room that has two queens in the main room and a queen in the side room. You must request that room in advance, it's downstairs and goes quick.  We like to thank guests who write reviews with 15% off their next visit. Ray, please print this out and show to our front desk agent for discount off standard rate.

Summary: I travel to Orange County often for vacation. I will always stay at this hotel! Great service, great price, and very clean! Very close to Disneyland and other attractions! I highly recommend this hotel for staying one night or many nights.
Manager Response: Orange county does have great all around weather and many attractions. Google maps says we are less than 10 minutes from Disneyland. Jamie, if you print your comment with my response you are eligible for a 15% discount off of our rack rate. Thank you

Summary: A quick trip on I-5 and five miles later Disneyland! Small pool, but easy parking, good breakfast and close to a local Krispy Kreme bakery. Ideal location to all surrounding parks. Simple no turn access to the interstate and a pharmacy next door if anything should arise.
Manager Response: Thank you William for taking the time to briefly describe the environment around Best Western Orange Plaza. Here we always appreciate all feedback. We are located centrally in Orange County and near Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, Beaches and we have our own downtown plaza to walk shop antiques and dine.  Thank you

Summary: Pillows in this hotel are very thick and crank your head in the air.  Bring your own pillow if you want to stay here.  Manager said CORPORATE made him buy the pillows.  CORPORATE needs to sleep on these MONSTERS.  We had encouraged our friends to stay here also and without prompting, the next morning they had the same complaint.
Manager Response: On behalf of Best Western Orange Plaza, I am very sorry for the experience with the pillows your party had. We have heard just about everything on the pillows from "where can I buy them",  "can I take one home and just charge my account" to "they need to go". All the amenities are Best Western brand compliance, however we will look into keeping a few smaller/thinner pillows on hand. We try to mold ourselves to every guests needs.

Summary: Owner has put a lot of work in to this hotel, to modernize it. It is always very clean, and the staff is always helpful, especially Mike at the front desk.  I definately reccomend this hotel. Although prices are competitive, they are on the rise.
Manager Response: Beverly thank you for your kind review. We try to make sure our guests are taken care of. With the best maids in town and a knowledgeable front desk staff we work as a team.  I'm sorry our rate has been going up, the demand goes up with the weather so goes the prices. Next time your back we'll work with you on the rate.  Thank you

Summary: I have stayed at this Best Western Orange Plaza in Orange,CA many times during the past 10 years. Not once have I been disappointed. Rooms are always clean and comfortable, the bedding always freshly changed, the pillows and mattress always up to date and comfortable.   They care and have definitely earned my loyalty. See you again, soon!
Manager Response: Thank you David. Working at the front desk I hear all the wonderful things you said about us all the time. Unfortunately many people tend to write when there's a negative experience and not when there are positive things to say. Thank you again and we can not wait to serve you and many guests to come.
