Summary: The rooms are very clean,our room was spotless. Front desk very helpful and friendly. There are many places to eat nearby. Easy access to freeways a few blocks away. I would stay there just to eat at  "Chile Peppers" next door. Book early for best prices
Manager Response: I have to second that our rooms are very clean and while spotless is a very strong word we do thank you for that. I work at the front desk and I always go out of my way to answer questions, copy papers, fax a document, call a cab, you name it and so do the other staff as mentioned. The best room rates can be had on bestwestern.com, search Best Western Orange Plaza and you will find our internet rate which is 15% off rack rate for the date you select. If all else fails call us and mention the 15% rack rate you saw on trip advisor, yelp etc.  Thank You for being involved on spreading the word about us.

Summary Heading: Best Western Orange Plaza, Orange, CA
Summary: One of the best Best Western Hotels I have stayed at. Old facility, but well maintained and clean. Quality of Service=Excellent. Quality of the breakfast=Excellent. Rate=great value for the stay. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Good services for a motel. The only negatives were the rate posted on the internet was not available and there was no blanket in the room. Quality of the food and amenities in the room were excellent. I would stay at this Best Western again and would recommend.

The Hotel is of a simpler kind.  It is on the corner of two fairly busy streets, but noise was not a problem once it became late as traffic calms down.  It is amongst many shops and plazas, so no shortage of stuff to walk to.  It is a very short drive to the historic city center.  The rooms are a bit on the small side, but were furnished ok.  The Hotel looks a bit old from the outside, but it currently being updated.

The staff members were helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and well cared for; though not luxurious, they fit our needs well. The room with the adjoining 'guest room' is very nice for a family of adults who want some privacy but don't want to pay for two rooms.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in the middle of many things.
Summary: Where do I start. The check in was super fast and polite. The rooms are supper clean a the beds are soooo comfortable! The shower has a super strong jet that will wake you up and revitalize you when that extra get up and go or relaxation before bed. Near the historic downtown Orange with a wide range of restaurants and shopping locations. Enjoy yourselves! I did!

We were visiting Chapman University and, as far as location, the Best Western was very convenient.  It is a "motel" so your door is to the outside making traffic noise more noticeable.  The room itself was clean and nicely furnished.  The parking is easy.  There is a large grocery store within walking distance and a very nice, reasonably priced Mexican restaurant for dinner (about 100 feet away). But the breakfast selection at the motel is poor with very limited seating, so plan to bring your breakfast back to your room.  Other reviewers said it was a good value but I felt otherwise. Maybe I'm not used to the LA prices.  Overall it was fine but If we were to return, I'd at least look into other hotels, even if they were a little farther away from Chapman.

Skip the breakfast (and the running complaining commentary from the front desk staff while you dine), ran out of coffee and juice; pool closed even though asked about it specifically when booking, no Wi-Fi signal, etc. etc.

BW at Orange Chapman Inn is a reliable, solid motel.  You know what you will and will not be getting. Time after time. The front desk is knowledgeable and very helpful about the surrounding area. I have been coming here for three years and it is always the same.

Given the price, this hotel was an excellent value in the center of Orange. Convenient to restaurants and shopping. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was basic, but consistent with the overall value. Rooms were very clean with fairly good furnishings.

Excellent Rooftop Bar, Great Rooms but they charge for everything at a five star hotel.  If I pay high rates, the internet should be free.  It is close to Old Town Square and the various tourist attractions and restaurants.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  Clean room.  Spacious.  The other services should be free.

Well-run and maintained. Close to Ralph's groceries, Walgreens, and numerous restaurants. Bed was very comfortable. Rooms were very quiet. Great location for Chapman parents; ask for the Chapman parent discount.

Summary Heading: A QUIET SMALLER DIAMOND IN ORANGE COUNTY
Summary: This property is well located, clean, modern rooms, great friendly staff, particularly Roger, 2 shopping malls across street, several major freeways a few blocks away for great access to beaches, Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Ball Park, Ice Arena. Only thing missing "Hot Tub"

The room was very nice especially with the extra side room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was terrible.  Simple packaged pastries you can get from a gas station, very little fruit, some yogurt, toast and a couple beverage choices was just about all that was offered.

We stayed here over 20 days when my mother was in a skilled care home in Orange. I am happy to report it was a very good stay and my mother was released to go home. When you are there every day, you have  time to notice things. First extremely clean and neat, No litter. The breakfast room is ample for 4 or 5 guests.  Fresh fruit, bowls, plates yogurt and the coffee was fine. When we were there they cleaned all the carpets. We didn't use the pool but it looked ok. Across the street is a full market and you can bring back dinner. Down Chapman, a couple blocks is a laundramat. Also clean n neat. Old town is minutes away with nice restaurants. All and all it was a good choice. We are returning to visit, we are out of state, and have just made reservations for two days.

The place was clean and quiet. All staff were courteous and professional. Room was clean and comfortable with a good layout. TV reception was not great though. Overall, I would use this particular hotel again and would recommend it. Its also close to Starbucks, MacDonalds and a nice breakfast care.

This BW is a good value for the price. Clean, easy to get to, and the staff is always helpful. I like the cleanliness of the outside of the facility, as well as the inside. Staff is always professional, but caring

Summary Heading: Clean motel close to Chapman University
Summary: Very clean motel, very nice staff. Everything you could want except a microwave and I believe there is one of those in the lobby. The room is very clean and the bed quite comfortable. Nice TV. Usually get a room on the second floor which is good for noise, but a pain for hauling suitcases up and down the stairs. Other than that really nice and very close to Chapman University.

Rooms seem to have been updated since i last stayed there 3 years ago.  The price is great for the location.  Staff were all very friendly, continental breakfast was a plus.  I would not say it is walking distance to downtown Orange, but a short drive to the circle and Chapman University.  Will consider staying again next time we are there

some of the hotel are not properly maintained. there are some good one's but so far there is alway something that I experience that you can complain about. Most often are the unpleasant smell of the room

The overall hotel was clean, easy accessible, ample parking, the room was clean, the breakfast was good. It was quiet and just a decent place to stay I think for the money that Best Western's and Comfort Inns are usually decent places to stay. I have never had a bad experience at any of them.

My 98 year old mom & I appreciated the caring service from the staff. It made our stay perfect! They were patient with us when we forgot our keys in the rooms...twice!...and when we needed extra towels, etc.

Older hotel but well maintained and price was excellent.  Like the location if you have a Chapman University student or visit.  Staff does a good job cleaning and maintaining an older facility.  Does have a limited breakfast, but worked out well.  Internet was good.  Will stay there again.

I found myself agreeing with a guest as she checked out, saying that she "would never stay anyplace else!"  I felt so welcome when I returned to stay for the weekend. The staff remembered me from my prior trip, and they were again so pleasant to be around. They engaged with the guests so that everyone felt "at home".  That personal touch provided by the staff goes a long way when traveling.  That, on top of the comfortable beds, the awesome shower heads, the proximity to everything, the excellent rates,  and the overall cleanliness of this Best Western, make it the best of the Best!

An excellent price and quality value.  Convenient to nearby Orange restaurants, activities, Chapman University.  Staff was friendly and professional.  Breakfast was good quality with reasonable selection.  I will be staying there again.  WiFi connection worked well, although session restarts were annoying. Kong bed was clean and comfortable.  I watched the staff make up my bed while working; no short cuts taken.

A good value. I will stay again. A good experience with everything clean, comfortable and updated. I was attending my High School reunion and didn't stay at the suggested hotel as it was twice the cost. Having stayed here before, I knew it would be just as nice with the value to-boot.

Summary Heading: My Best Stay at a Best Western
Summary: Best Western Orange Plaza is a great hotel. The staff is very personable, courteous, and customer service oriented. Their friendly and helpful demeanor was very welcoming, and we felt comfortable and safe in their hands. The furnishings seemed new, decor tasteful, and the beds were very comfortable. The entire place was very clean- the windows; the pool; the front office and breakfast area; the outside seating; and even the parking lot.  The location is not far from anything, but close to everything. Disneyland, Angel Stadium, Chapman University and Old Town, the hospitals, shopping, groceries, restaurants, laundromats, and the train, to name a few.  We will definitely stay at this hotel again. We had a great experience, and it was a great value for the price. Can't beat that!

Needed a room on a Saturday last minute. Member of BWR program and found this hotel. Reviews were good so we gave it a try. Lots of room for the family (5) with 3 actual beds (not just a sofa sleeper) which was nice. Clean and simple. If I had to pick something negative it would be no spa and the carpet was lifting up by the front door in room. Restaurants and stores close by. Did the job. Would stay here again.

I have stayed at many Best Westerns throughout the western USA and have to say this is one of the most challenged.  First, location is challenging because there is only one access in and out and cannot make U-turn so you are forced to drive farther than necessary.  Second is Internet. Other reviewers said Internet was terrible and I concur.  I stayed six nights and only on day four did the Internet tech support fix the problem with my Internet access with iPad.  Front desk tried to help but tech support had to be called multiple times.  Personally I think they need different Internet service and cable as there few channels to choose from...and I am NOT an avid TV person.  Newly remodeled BWs have a chair instead of a table in the rooms which is much more comfortable. Breakfast

We were looking for a place close to Angels Stadium, so we could walk to and from the concert we were attending... This hotel was a little less than 2 miles from the stadium... easy walk to the stadium and it was a fairly inexpensive cab ride back at the end of the night... nice accommodations... swimming pool... clean... good breakfast options... right across the street from a Starbucks... We would definitely stay here again, if we come back to the area!

We secured this hotel through Hotwire, and were concerned after reading other reviews. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. It's a small place which makes it quaint, not a lot of people around. We received an upstairs corner room. It had everything one needed inside, including a fridge, a pleasant touch when traveling. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioner worked well.   The only issue we had while there were loud guest outside of the rooms in the morning, but what are you going to do about that?   They have some quick bites in the am if you like something small. We never actually ate there, we picked up something on the way to Disney. Easy access to Disney and the Disney parking lot.   If you want a place that is inexpensive, you will be pleasantly surprised

very clean hotel.  nothing to look at from outside but rooms are very clean and spacious.  Nice morning free breakfast.  Only two tables to sit at for breakfast.  I would suggest staying on second floor for noise.  Close to Disney.  A lot of sirens at night but rooms seem to be noise protected.  We had motorcyclists staying there that decided to start bikes at 6:30 am.  no fault of hotel.  TV stations were full of static.  Bed comfortable.  Queen beds.

We have family in the area, so it's helpful to locate the hotel that best fits our needs-- a little respite, close to family.  This Best Western has been good to us many times over.  The hot tub is just wonderful!  It can get crowded as it's close to Disney Land, but the internal landscaping helps a lot to increase the peace.

Summary Heading: Great location at a great price
Summary: Visiting grand kids and this was the closest hotel.  What we found was that this was a convenient location to the attractions s such as Wet and Wild Water Park, Gatorland, Universal, and of course Disney.  Hot tub was out, #sadface , but pool was working.  Check in staff were friendly and helpful.  Easy access to WalMart for lunch items and water shirts.  Lots of good little restsutants.  Ate a a Puerto Rican and Cajun place.  Get on the rewards program.  Its worth it.

Tried earnestly TO CHECK IN "ON-LINE" AND RECIEVE THE $76. RATE FOR "ON LINE CHECK IN".  Struggled long and hard without success.  Then called Best Western...ended up being charged $85. per night.  Nice people, nice accomadations, BUT disappoiinted in the $10.00 a night over-charge compared to the "on-line" promise.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about the situation with the online price. That is controlled by our central reservations department and if something like that happens, call the 800 number. The special online price is subject to limited quantities and sometimes requires a two or more night stay on some peak weekends.  FYI we have a drive thru where you can park steps from the office, check-in and park closest space near your room.

Summary: Really enjoyed my stay here...it is a very well maintained "motel" style accomodation, with easy access and excellent rates.  I would recommend this Best Western to anyone looking for quiet and economical accomodations.
Manager Response: What can I say, we are a great little hotel that is quiet and well maintained. I like to think of us as that find not everyone knows about yet. We don't have the big suites and hot tubs but we offer a place to stay that's like home while on business or vacation.  If your looking to stay multiple nights between Sunday-Thursday, call us and ask for Michael. I can offer you discounted rates based on stay.

Summary: nice but 9od hotel. Would have been helpful to have snacks in lobby to purchase, they did nnot.  Highly appreciated the tip on where to have dinner. The hotel staff suggested an excellent restraunt around the corner that I will go to again.
Manager Response: Best Western Orange Plaza is located within walking distance of the famous Old Towne Orange Plaza (Circle). Rent a bike there, go antique shopping, enjoy the weather. There are many restaurants, bars, and pubs to choose from if your looking for a bite to eat or to cool off. Our knowledgeable staff has many recommendations and can map you around town.  Car rental and Aquarium of the Pacific coupons located at front desk.

Summary: This was a last minute trip to Disneyland and most hotels were booked or way too expensive and the Best Western Orange Plaza had a room at a fair price. We got a room with 2 queen beds on the bottom floor. This hotel is old and needs some fixing up...not a 3 star. The carpet was very dirty so we kept our socks on so our feet didn't turn black...just the socks did. The shower had mold and I was afraid to take a shower. The hotel was booked up for the night so we couldn't change rooms. The beds were comfortable and we slept good. The breakfast was cereal and muffins in the small lobby were you check in. This place was ok, but if I had to stay here again I'd think twice before going.
Manager Response: Our hotel is close to many Orange County attractions and you don't have to pay the high prices of Disneyland hotels or beach hotels. We are located only 15 minutes from Disneyland, 10 minutes from Angel Stadium, 15 minutes from John Wayne Airport, 20 minutes from the Orange County Fair and 30 minutes away from the beach.   There are many discounts on bestwestern.com, go there and see our internet only offer.

Summary: We were led to believe that this is a 3 star hotel, but it's really a decent motel. We stayed here while on a Disneyland vacation with a child and an infant.   The carpet was so dirty that the baby had black hands, feet and knees after crawling on it. We mentioned it to the front desk and they were apologetic and cleaned the carpet in our room and seven others while we were out for the day. They never fully dried and were still fairly dirty, but better. We appreciated the effort.   The breakfast was simple, but met our needs. We didn't use the pool, as it was a little chilly, but it looked clean.   The location was good. It took us about 10 minutes to get to and from Disneyland. Summary Heading: Nice Place to Stay for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: This is a small pleasant motel.  There are about 50 nicely appointed, clean rooms.  There is a small pool but it was a bit too cold for us to use.  The beds were very comfortable.  There were medium size refrigs and coffee makers in all rooms.  The tv's were all large flat screens with a wide selection of channels.  The free WiFi was a bit slow, but what do you want for free.  The breakfast was simple but ample.  There are nicier places closer to the parks, but they are also a few times more than then this place.  The Best Western Orange Plaza is a nice place in a good neighborhood.  It took us about 5 minutes to get to Disneyland and 10 minutes to reach Knott's Berry Farms.  It is about a 45 to 60 minute trip to downtown LA.
Manager Response: I would like to add a couple of other details to this positive review. Everyone of our 32 rooms has a high speed internet cable for faster internet speeds. Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Anaheim Convention Ctr or Chapman Univ
Summary: Needed a room within short driving distance of Anaheim Convention Ctr, but outside of the crowded & overpriced Anaheim area. Hotel was affordably priced, and easy side-streets drive to/fro the Conv Ctr.
Manager Response: Here's a helpful tip from our friendly staff. Book a Kind bed up to 2 adults at our internet only rate for Best Western Orange Plaza under discounts.

Summary: I was in Orange to interview and audition for Chapman University. The location doesn't get much better. My only complaint about that is the homeless people that were literally 10 feet away from my room near the AT&T store. I'm not sure there's much the hotel could really do about that though. You also can see the Disneyland fireworks every night from your hotel room if you're upstairs. The room is pretty clean. It's definitely nicer than you would expect from a motel. The decor is updated. The only issue we had was the heat. The room would either be too hot or too cold. That issue made it hard to sleep at night. Maybe that was just a fluke with our room though. Manager Response: I feel honored to be mentioned in this review, I take pride in making sure guests enjoy their stay at Best Western Orange Plaza. If you are visiting Chapman University or are a relative of someone attending make sure to call us and let us know to receive a Chapman Discount.

Summary: It was a decent hotel. Nothing great to say but nothing bad. It was clean and in a great location. Continental breakfast was the usual cereal, fruit and bagels. Close to lots of good stuff. Not far from Disneyland either.

Clean Best Western Orange. Clean nice room with flat screen TV.  Clean refreshing pool. Adequate comtinental breakfast. Close to restaurants on Old Town Orange Circle. 1.5 miles in less than 10 minutes to Chapman Univ. for campus tour.

Stayed here to visit my ailing Aunt. The front desk personnel were nice enough. Probably the best part of our stay was the surprisingly nice continental breakfast the following morning in the lobby, and the only reason I give this motel 3 stars. The accomodations themselves were fine, but needed major help in the the cleanliness department, however. The A/C was blowing out tiny damp gray chunks of something, accompanied with a very musty smell. I wondered how much of the "gray yuck" I had breathed in during the night. The hotel has rooms that are very clean and also very nice.  There is a nice pool on the property.  It is convenient to have the mini-business center.  Continental breakfast is served.  Location is very convenient..less than 3 miles to either the Anaheim Stadium or Honda Center.   Close to nice eating places.  And last but not least I have to mention the simply outstanding customer service skills of the front desk agent Ed and the young man who works the day shift!

I have to admit after reading some of the reviews (comments about the staff), I was a little wary about booking a reservation but it was near the event we were attending and the price was right...    Well, I shouldn't have been worried.  The front desk folks were very nice and helpful.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  The grounds are well-maintained.  Nice hotel overall.  They had several options for the continental breakfast (but double check the bread items).  Definitely recommend

The room was clean, with adequate space to move around, and good storage space. There was a refrigerator but no microwave. There was a large flat screen TV. The shower had both a grab bar and a rubber mat.  Continental breakfast was quite varied, with three tables in the lobby and some tables outdoors.. No coin operated washers and dryers at this motel. Front desk personnel were helpful. This BW was a good place to stay for several nights

Summary Heading: Hotel - Very Nice, Staff - Not So Much
Summary: While the hotel itself is friendly and welcoming, the front desk day staff leaves much to be desired.  I had called ahead of time to see if I was able to check in early, was told that it wouldnt be a problem. However, when I arrived, I was told that I had to wait until after 2pm to check in. The  desk clerk was not friendly at all, and certainly did not make me feel welcomed at the establishment.  When I originally checked in I was unsure of my length of stay. I stayed a total of 3 days, each morning going in to the office and paying for another night.  On the second day, the desk clerk's comment was "Arent you going home yet?"  He was not kidding!!  The swing and night shift clerks were just the opposite - very pleasant to speak to and very accomadating when I needed something.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay inexpensively with friendly, courteous and helpful staff
Summary: I have stayed in many hotels in Orange County and this was perfect for the price.  We spent three nights in this hotel and enjoyed it very much.  Our king room was large and extremely clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  Bathroom was large and clean.  The pool and area surrounding it was beautiful and so clean.   The hanging baskets of flowers on the 2nd level were pleasant to look at.  Parking spaces were more than adequate and NO parking fees.   Location is close to freeway and close to OC courts and downtown.  I liked everything about this property.  Not one complaint.

Summary Heading: Great Value and good location for Chapman and Disneyland visits
Summary: My wife and two teen age girls have stayed here about four times in the last three years.  We find it to be a clean, comfortable place to sleep when we visit our daughter who attends Chapman University as well as 5 minutes from Disneyland.  The staff has always seemed to go above and beyond to accommodate us.  Keep in mind, this is a small L shaped two story motel with a small outdoor swimming pool.  There is a breakfast nook where you can get cereal, bagels, danish, toast, juice & coffee in the lobby, which is included in the price of the stay.  It has free Wifi and is near Highway 5, downtown Orange, Chapman University, Angel Stadium and the Disneyland resort.  The rooms provided a coffee maker, an empty refrigerator, desk, table and very comfortable bed.
we get great spa treatment and relax in this hotel as well. it is the fantastic place for getting pleasure.

Summary Heading: Good basic motel-- clean, comfortable, basic rooms
Summary: I was assigned this hotel by Priceline's "name your own price" feature. The hotel looks like it was built in the 70s, but it was recently remodeled. My room was completely clean. It included an Aeron-type desk chair and a tube TV with free HBO. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a basic tub/shower and toilet affair. The air conditioner was noisy but effective, even on a 100-degree day. The pool was reasonably large but because there was absolutely no shade in the pool area, I didn't use it (there were metal tables and chairs, but no umbrellas or overhangs.) The continental breakfast included coffee, packaged pastries, toast, bagels, fruit, and juice. There was a computer terminal in the lobby for guests' use at no charge. Summary Heading: A bad link in the Best Western chain!
Summary: I noticed that other reviews of this hotel noted that the staff is rude. THIS IS TRUE! VERY RUDE STAFF! The hotel itself lives up to Best Western standards, but from the manager on down, this hotel is one of the unfriendliest places I have ever stayed. Take note, the maids will turn off your a/c and set the alarm early when given the chance so check your clock! They want you out of the room asap! Very discourteous staff that could care less if you have a nice stay or not. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere!
Big plus is that it isn't in Anaheim, but only a few minutes away. Room OK but the aircon noisy as always. Pool good. Breakfast OK. Staff helpful.  Good restaurants locally.

I usually live in Best Western SNA when I travel to OC. The room is quite normal as the price is on the right level. It should be a convinent place to stay for you trip but not a cool, fun, and romatic resort.

While the room itself lived up to the standard Best Western quality I would come to expect, the employees were extremely rude.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, but if you do decide to stay here, I hope they don't lecture you for something you weren't even planning to do, with nothing to support their conclusions except their own stereotypes and assumptions.

Plusses: - ten minutes from Disneyland - nice pool - interior decoration looks upscale - clean & quiet - attentive staff - supermarket,  restaurant & Starbucks nearby  Minuses: - very firm beds - so-so continental breakfast  Overall: - Very good value
